member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.RecalibrationSettings.SelectionText
member.summary: SQL query text for track selection.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.RecalibrationSettings.MinXDistance
member.summary: Minimum X distance spanned by the recalibration tracks.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.RecalibrationSettings.MinYDistance
member.summary: Minimum Y distance spanned by the recalibration tracks.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.RecalibrationSettings.BaseThickness
member.summary: Recalibration tracks are centered in the field of view by assuming this thickness for the plastic base.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.RecalibrationSettings.PositionToleranceIncreaseWithSlope
member.summary: Longitudinal position tolerance for recalibration. The actual tolerance is PositionTolerance + Slope * PositionToleranceIncreaseWithSlope.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.RecalibrationSettings.SlopeToleranceIncreaseWithSlope
member.summary: Longitudinal slope tolerance for recalibration. The actual tolerance is SlopeTolerance + Slope * SlopeToleranceIncreaseWithSlope.

member.name: T:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ReuseSettings
member.summary: Settings for the data reuse policy.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ReuseSettings.MinOverlapArea
member.summary: Minimum overlap area between this zone and another zone already in the DB to reuse the latter.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ReuseSettings.MinOverlapFraction
member.summary: Minimum fraction of the total area that overlaps between this zone and another zone already in the DB to reuse the latter.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ReuseSettings.MaxMissingArea
member.summary: Maximum area missing if another zone is reused.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ReuseSettings.ProgramSettingsIds
member.summary: The list of the program settings in the TB_PROGRAMSETTINGS table whose generated zones are considered compatible with the quality required by this configuration. When Enable is set to true, data obtained with this same configuration are always considered compatible. Since the programsettings Id for this configuration is generated by the DB upon program insertion, it can never appear in this list, but it is implicitly included a posteriori.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.QualitySettings.MaxTrials
member.summary: If the scanned zone does not satisfy the quality requirement, it is rescanned, until the quality is satisfactory or this maximum number of trials is reached. If the maximum number of trials is reached, the zone is in any case written to the DB.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.AreaScan2Settings.ScanningConfigId
member.summary: Program settingds Id for the scanning server.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.AreaScan2Settings.QualityCutId
member.summary: Progrsam settings Id for quality cuts.

member.name: T:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ScanningResult
member.summary: Result of scanning. It includes candidate information, meaningful for recalibration tracks.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ScanningResult.CandidateId
member.summary: For recalibration tracks, the Id of the candidate.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ScanningResult.DPX
member.summary: X component of displacement between found and predicted position.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ScanningResult.DPY
member.summary: Y component of displacement between found and predicted position.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ScanningResult.DSX
member.summary: X component of misalignment between found and predicted slope.

member.name: F:SySal.DAQSystem.Drivers.AreaScan2Driver.ScanningResult.DSY
member.summary: Y component of misalignment between found and predicted slope.

remarks.para: AreaScan2Driver scans areas in a plate, checking data quality, and optionally reusing old data.
All input and output come from the DB. Areas are read from TB_VOLUME_SLICES and results are written to the same table.
Before real scanning, a recalibration can be computed using "safe" tracks. The selection must return the following columns, in this order: POSX POSY SLOPEX SLOPEY
_BRICK_ will be replaced with the brick ID. _PLATE_ will be replaced with the plate ID.

Supported Interrupts:
IgnoreScanFailure False|True instructs AreaScan2Driver to stop on failed zones or to skip them and go on.
IgnoreRecalFailure False|True instructs AreaScan2Driver to stop on failed recalibration tracks or to skip them and go on.
Type: AreaScan2Driver /EasyInterrupt for a graphical user interface to send interrupts.

The following substitutions apply:
%EXEREP%Executable repository path specified in the Startup file.
%RWDDIR%Output directory for Raw Data.
%TLGDIR%Output directory for linked zones.
%RWD%Scanning output file name (not including extension).
%TLG%Linked zone file name (not including extension).
%SCRATCH%Scratch directory specified in the Startup file.
%ZONEID%Hexadecimal file name for a zone.

A sample XML configuration for AreaScan2Driver follows:
<AreaScan2Settings> <ScanningConfigId>105382855</ScanningConfigId> <LinkConfigId>108888238</LinkConfigId> <QualityCutId>108382880</QualityCutId> <Recalibration> <SelectionText>select POSX, POSY, SLOPEX, SLOPEY from (select ID_ZONE, POSX, POSY, SLOPEX, SLOPEY, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY ID_ZONE ORDER BY ID) AS RNUM from TB_MIPBASETRACKS where ID_EVENTBRICK = _BRICK_ and ID_ZONE in (select ID from TB_ZONES where ID_EVENTBRICK = _BRICK_ and ID_PROCESSOPERATION in (select CALIBRATION from VW_PLATES where ID_EVENTBRICK = _BRICK_ and ID = _PLATE_)) and GRAINS > 27 and SQRT(SLOPEX*SLOPEX+SLOPEY*SLOPEY) < 0.25 and SQRT(SLOPEX*SLOPEX+SLOPEY*SLOPEY) > 0.05) where RNUM <= 5</SelectionText> <MinXDistance>30000</MinXDistance> <MinYDistance>30000</MinYDistance> <MinTracks>8</MinTracks> <BaseThickness>210</BaseThickness> <PositionTolerance>60</PositionTolerance> <PositionToleranceIncreaseWithSlope>6</PositionToleranceIncreaseWithSlope> <SlopeTolerance>0.03</SlopeTolerance> <SlopeToleranceIncreaseWithSlope>0.3</SlopeToleranceIncreaseWithSlope> </Recalibration> <Reuse> <Enable>true</Enable> <MinOverlapArea>16000000</MinOverlapArea> <MinOverlapFraction>0.95</MinOverlapFraction> <MaxMissingArea>100000</MaxMissingArea> <ProgramSettingsIds> <long>183288</long> <long>164734</long> <long>136829</long> </ProgramSettingsIds> </Reuse> <Quality> <MinDensityBase>4E-05</MinDensityBase> <MaxTrials>2</MaxTrials> </Quality> </AreaScan2Settings>

para.b: NOTICE: If the quality cut id is identical to the linker id, no quality cut is applied (unless the linker applies its own quality cuts).
